messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Strong Women TV role models (was Wishcraft)
messages.msgSnippet: KathrynJB@aol.com writes:  I guess I like to be teased. lol  They
messages.messageBody:
KathrynJB@... writes:

<< After a while you get tired of the subtext, and you just want action. Or
something. >>

I guess I like to be teased. lol They kissed in the series finale, but it
was a gyp. (SP?) But the Sappho poem, now there was a fantastic romantic moment.
True love and all that. ;-)

<<Well, Buffy is much cooler than the rest of us. (Sort of like Joni
Mitchell)
I don't even know how Ordinary, non-super-power people walk in high heels.

Kathryn, who desperately needs a vacation
>>

LOL


~Aimee

messages.subject: Re: Strong Women TV role models (was Wishcraft)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/6/2003 6:22:33 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... I went to high school with a guy who often came to school dressed as Wonder Woman. He also
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/6/2003 6:22:33 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> <<I was a preteen when Charlie's ANgels and the Bionic Woman and Wonder
> Woman
> were all on. They were my heroes. Jaime Sommers in particular. I'm still
> a huge fan of Lindsey Wagner and Jackie Smith. >>
>
> I loved Wonder Woman too. I think I was her for Halloween at least 3 times.
>
>


I went to high school with a guy who often came to school dressed as Wonder
Woman. He also mostly did murals of her in art. I have no idea how he turned
out.

> <<They were the first women who kicked any kind of butt. >>
>
> That's why I loved Xena too ( well, that and the lesbian subtext!)
>


After a while you get tired of the subtext, and you just want action. Or
something.

> <<And Buffy still ain't perfect. 'Cause she's too damn perfect, if you
> know
> what I mean.
>
> Kelly
> (Bionic wannabe)>>
>
> I never watched that, but I saw the series finale. When all those girls
> became slayers, the girl playing Little League, etc, I cried.
>
> But, yah, how does Buffy slay with high heeled shoes? My hubby said they're
>
> extra spikes for the vampires? lol
>

Well, Buffy is much cooler than the rest of us. (Sort of like Joni Mitchell)
I don't even know how Ordinary, non-super-power people walk in high heels.

Kathryn, who desperately needs a vacation


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
